newsitem.title: UK: DIARY-UK Share Issues- Billiton, Debonair, Gremlin.
newsitem.headline: DIARY-UK Share Issues- Billiton, Debonair, Gremlin.

text.p: Next week's expected stock market debutantes include two companies that make their profits from opposite sides of the earth's surface.
Mining house Billiton Plc is due to make its debut on the London Stock Exchange (LSE) on July 23 at an initial price expected to be between 210p and 240p per share.

Analysts estimate Billiton will be valued between 4.4 billion and 5.1 billion stg. The company was demerged from South African parent Gencor Ltd and will be one of the world's biggest producers of aluminium, nickel and coal.
Billiton said it hoped to be admitted to the FTSE 100 index of Britain's leading stocks in the near future, which would make it the second largest mining stock in the UK after Rio Tinto Plc.

Share dealing in pan-European airline owner Debonair Holdings Plc is due to take-off on the new growth stock market EASDAQ on July 24 and the company is expected to be valued at around 100 million stg.
Debonair said it planned to take advantage of the deregulation process in Europe's airline industry and pledged to establish itself as a low fare, "home-based" airline in many European destinations.
The company hopes to raise around 25 million stg from its flotation.

Making their debut on the same day will be shares in video software group Gremlin Plc. Gremlin makes games for PC CD Rom, and for dedicated games consoles such as the Sony PlayStation, Sega Saturn and Nintendo 64. The shares are expected to debut at 159 pence.
The company earned pre-tax profits of 2.5 million stg in the nine months to April 30 1997.
